document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Grismado, C. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Grismado, C. J. (2008) A taxonomic revision of the spider genus Ariadna Audouin, 1826 in Argentina and Chile, with the description of five new species (Arachnida, Araneae, Segestriidae). Zoosystema, 30 (2), 333 - 360.
bibRefCitation.title: A taxonomic revision of the spider genus Ariadna Audouin, 1826 in Argentina and Chile, with the description of five new species (Arachnida, Araneae, Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariadna levii Grismado, 2008 : 345
, figs 5D‒E, 6D‒I (♂ holotype from N of Tiltil [33°04'00"S; 71°01'59"W], 800‒1300m , Cuesta La Dormida, Santiago, RM Región Metropolitana de Santiago, Chile, 13‒18.XI.1982 , L. Peña leg., deposited in AMNH, examined; ♂ paratype from farmland, Isla Teja, ValdiVia, X Región de Los Lagos, Chile, 6.III.1965 , H. LeVi leg., deposited in MCZ 47261, not examined).— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

Additional material examined: CHILE :
V Región de Valparaíso : Petorca Province :
Zapallar [ 32°33'13"S ; 71°27'32"W ], Acon., 1♂ ,
27.XI.1950
, Ross & Michelbacher leg. ( CAS 9046508 )
;
Valparaíso [ 33°03'S ; 71°37'W ], 1♀ ,
IV.1970
, Fritz leg. (MACN-Ar 10509);
VII Región de Maule :
Cauquenes Province :
Cauquenes, R. N. Los Ruiles, elev. 174M ( 35°50'02.6"S ; 72°30'35.7"W ), 3♂ 1imm.,
17.VII.2010
, A. Ojanguren et al. leg. (MACN-Ar 29452);
Curicó Province :
Curicó , Las Tablas , East of Curicó ( 34°59'S ; 71°14'W ), 2♀ 2imm.,
II.1985
, L. Peña leg. ( AMNH );
IX Región de Araucanía :
Cautín Province :
Temuco , Cerro Ñielol [ 38°43'40.91"S ; 72°32'34.42"W ], 1♂ ,
15.I.1989
, M. Ramírez leg. (MACN-Ar 10088);
XIV
Región de Los Ríos
:
Valdivia Province :
Valdivia [ 39°49'51"S ; 73°13'15"W ], 3♀ , 1983, E. Krahmer leg. ( MHNS 836 )
.

Diagnosis.
Ariadna levii
is similar to
A. crassipalpa
,
A. mollis
,
A. boesenbergi , A. calilegua
,
A. changellkuk
and
A. perkinsi
due to the dark abdominal pattern with arrow-shaped marks ( Figs 1A‒C , 18A, F , 20A, F , 22A, F , 31A, E , 45A, F , 47A, F , 50A, F ), but males differ by the presence of metatarsi I straight with two apophyses: one ventro-prolateral bearing a short and curved macrosetae, and a ventro-retrolateral one, with non-modified macrosetae ( Fig. 50C‒E ; Grismado 2008 , fig. 6H); females are distinguished by the presence of a dorsal lobe longer than the ventral lobe ( Fig. 51C‒D ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 50.
Ariadna levii Grismado, 2008
. Male from R. N. Los Ruiles (MACN-Ar 29452) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); right leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D); right metatarsus I (E). Female from Valdivia (MHNS 836) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 51.
Ariadna levii Grismado, 2008
. Male from R. N. Los Ruiles (MACN-Ar 29452) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral view (A) (arrowhead = chemosensory patch), and retrolateral view (B). Female from Valdivia (MHNS 836) (C‒D): internal genitalia, lateral view (E); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (F). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Male (n=6): Total length 5.08‒7.24; carapace 2.08‒3.72 long, 1.84‒2.28 wide; femur I 2.44‒3.0. Female (n=5): Total length 7.44‒9.68; carapace 3.2‒4.16 long, 1.96‒2.48 wide; femur I 2.04‒2.76.
